definition: (towards, turn) colloquial- short for advertisement
(towards, turn) attentive; heedful
(towards, turn) describe publicly to promote sales
(towards, turn) a commercial solicitation, public notice
(towards, turn) advertisement that looks like an editorial
(away, turn) to prevent, turn away
(against, turn) to argue against, dispute
(towards, turn) someone who has turned to religion or someone in favour of something that he previously opposed or disliked.
(towards, turn) a person or thing that changes someone or something
(towards, turn) able to be changed
(away, turn) to turn aside, deflect, distract
(out, turn) to turn inside out
(out, turn) outgoing, sociable
(out, turn) outgoing, sociable
(not, towards, turn) the quality of being unaware without noticing
(not, against, turn) cannot be argued against, disputed
(inward, turn) One who focuses on their own affairs
(inward, turn) in a contrary order of direction
(thoroughly, turn) unaccepatble sexual habits
(again, turn) one who or that which goes back
(under, turn) To overturn from the foundation; to ruin utterly.
(turn) small bones that make up the backbone
(turn) the highest point, whirling column
(turn) a sensation of turning or spinning
